comment: I've taken two of her classes (IT3203 and IT3003) and she's one of my favorite professors. She places lots of emphasis on group projects and class participation. Her lectures will typically engage the class, as she likes to hear feedback when teaching. She takes notice of the effort you show in class and will use that when grading.

Schedule was all over the place, said things were supposed to be due on Sundays but some things were not. Class is mainly group projects and it's not always clear if it was a full group project or to split the groups. Besides that it's a super easy class and you can easily get away with not trying, most of the information is common sense.

Amazing professor. I think this semester she really is a good professor and she truely cares for her students. I would ignore the old reviews and turn the page as in class she is great. Everyone has there challenges and she really cares for her students! Please take this professor.

CYBR3223. This is the worst online course I have taken. She uploads lectures partway and links to random websites through the module, half of which lead to 404s. Seems she's finding them as we go. The info is useless too; I have an assignment due tomorrow night about a concept that isn't mentioned in a single resource she's provided. Beware.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment:
Class layout:

Quizzes (7): 15%(open notes, difficult)
Projects (3): 40%
Assignments (3): 20%
Group writing: 25%

If you care about your GPA and actually learning avoid this professor at all costs. She literally reads off the powerpoints, responds late to emails and her response is completely different from the question.

YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED.

The course could have been organized a little better and the syllabus could have matched up with the actual deadlines. This professor is very picky about her assignments but also provides feedback on what she wants. Wish she would provide a very detailed guideline for assignments before the due date. BE PREPARED!! Assignments were too bad.
Take anyone else. This was the most unorganized course I have ever taken at KSU. No clear deadlines. This course is easy but it was such a headache to determine what was due and when.
Students beware. Unorganized and unprofessional. No clear grading. No clear deadlines. Not worth the money. Choose any other instructor for this course.

This class was an overall mess. Professor Tucker's class was very unorganized and a lot of students were lost the entire time. She also is very nitpicky with her grading, and will take off alot of points for something as minor as not including the course number. Her exams are short answer. The powerpoints she provide are not good.

Prof. Tucker has clearly never taught this class before. Beware of strict grading! She gave me an 82% on a paper because I wrote the wrong course number and only had one citation. She didn't provide a rubric, and the paper was a "self-reflection." You aren't supposed to need citations in a self-reflection! Overall, not a great experience.

Ms. Tucker is very good. You will have discussion posts, quizzes, and to end it off a group project. But it is all very manageable and she tells you everything you need step by step. If anything is unclear stay after to ask her questions.
rating_tags: Group projects--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback
